body:
Motivation:
No easy way to start a comment with builtin commenting. Some commenting plugins provide commands to start a comment in the next line or at the end of line.
See also: https://github.com/neovim/neovim/discussions/28995.

Solution:
An insert mode command `<C-/>` to put comment markers around cursor. `o<C-/>` starts a comment in the next line, `A <C-/>` starts at the end of the line.

NOTE:
This default mapping overrides the builtin `CTRL-_` command for toggling revins.

comment_data.body: This depends on the terminal emulator. You may need to map both.

If this PR is going to trigger requests for a public interface, let's just close this PR. 

Alternatively, we should start exposing builtin plugins as plugins, as we did for `editorconfig`. Not everything needs to live on `vim.*`. I'm actually not sure why `_comment` lives on `vim.`.

comment_regular_data.body: Sorry to spoil the fun. I am wondering whether the idea and design have been discusssd deeply in other places. And, I dont think `c-/` is uncontroversial or widely recognised among (n)vim users. Just my personal opinion.

I'm also not sure about having this as a default option (wouldn't this be something an user can write in their config?), but if I were to introduce any default keymap `ctrl-/` in the insert mode, I would prefer that it works like toggling (which is a common behavior found in other IDEs and editors) as `gcc` does.

> I would prefer that it works like toggling (which is a common behavior found in other IDEs and editors) as gcc does.

with this, it's still not easy to add comment at the end of an existing line, e.g.,
```
code; /* comment */
```

> wouldn't this be something an user can write in their config?

this is difficult unless `get_comment_parts` is exposed as public api

If this gets shot down, can we at least make `get_commentstring` public? It's totally fair to say no to additional niceties, though it is a shame that the current implementation is pretty rigid and extending it is only possible with duplicated code (through plugins or in config)

I don't think adding comment markers needs a separate built-in mapping, especially with not tried and tested keys.

> If this gets shot down, can we at least make `get_commentstring` public?

I think using `vim.bo.commentstring` directly covers way above overwhelming majority of cases.

That said, either adding something like `vim.treesitter.get_option()` or `position` option to either `vim.filetype.get_option()` or `vim.api.nvim_get_option_value()` which can get option value *at certain position* seems reasonable.

Thanks, @github-actions!

My "review" is [here](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/28997#issuecomment-2137228964), as in "I don't think this functionality is a good fit for core".
